case.name: Applicant M221/2003 v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCA 45 (3 February 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: applicant a woman with culturally induced reluctance to divulge to men what had happened to her
indications in material in support of application that she had not divulged everything
tribunal member made no attempt to ascertain what more she might say
relevance of ministerial guidelines for dealing with gender-related claims
whether guidelines applicable to tribunal estoppel
res judicata , issue estoppel and anshun estoppel
previous proceedings in respect of same decision of refugee review tribunal
denial of procedural fairness not raised
could not have been raised in previous federal court proceeding
not raised in previous high court proceeding
application for order nisi dismissed by consent courts and judges

whether discretion miscarried abuse of process

application to review decision of refugee review tribunal brought out of time

re commonwealth of australia & anor; ex parte marks practice and procedure
factors to be considered. constitutional law

role of full bench on appeal. practice and procedure

whether proceedings commenced "vexatiously or without reasonable cause".
re ruddock & ors; ex parte reyes constitutional law

contractual indemnity by hirer against loss caused to owner from use of plant
action for damages against hirer and owner arising out of use of plant
notices of contribution between hirer and owner
subsequent action by owner for indemnity

unexplained period of delay in commencing these proceedings
seven year delay in application for judicial review

citances.sentence:
(references omitted)
He submits that since constitutional writs are directed at acts or decisions of public bodies or officials, public interest requires that there be an end to litigation: Applicant M221/2003 v Minister for Immigration [2006] FCA 45 at [19] .

33 An important consideration which informs the exercise of the discretion on the ground of delay is that the public interest requires there be an end to litigation about the efficacy of acts and decisions of public bodies and officials; see Applicant M221 v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCA 45 at [19] per Weinberg J; see also the Full Court in S58 at [4].
